Based on the visual evidence, this segment is best classified as **Washing dishes**.

* **Dish Rack:** A prominent dish rack filled with washed or dirty dishes is visible.
* **Sink Area:** The activity appears to be centered around a sink, a common area for washing dishes.

* **Water Flow:** In some of the frames, there's a visible flow of water from the faucet, strongly suggesting washing is in progress.

could it could even the data set could possibly even be used in both things but for different purposes yeah because the type of tasks in in VBS and LSE are technically as in how they're implemented very similar semantically they're still quite different. And I mean to be honest like if you take we have a decent share of wedding videos in the present I mean like a group of people being at a wedding is not so different of us being here. But we've never done anything with it explicitly, right? So we don't have the wedding subtask. I think this is something we could possibly do for whatever comes after v3c. If there are some directions and say, well, we will inevitably run out of v3c probably within two years or so um so then we might anyway need to design something something else that has new properties for interesting challenges that we foresee for for the future do you see vbs being able to have a track for this data set where somebody can take part but not take part in the VLC data centric that definitely can fit to VPS because yeah I mean how would you split the track yeah I don't know a separate session then that's that's anyway something that is increasingly a problem with vvs we have seen this this year that we had so many different things going on so many different combinations of data sets and task types that for every company so for every single combination there were only very few instances so the amount of data that we actually have, the amount of results, keeps getting smaller and smaller. And it keeps getting increasingly difficult to draw any conclusions from this. So either we cut down on this or we lean into it. Cutting down would mean we go, we keep the timeframe of saying, look, this is a most, well, half-day actual challenge, so full-day event, but there's still some time to everybody getting settled. And then we only have the six hours or so to actually do evaluations, and there's only so many tasks, need to scope this stuff or we say no there's going to be tracks people can sign up for four tracks and then this might be a two-day thing that runs even possibly in parallel to some of the more of the main conference because it just needs more time and then we say explicitly okay this type of thing is on first day in the morning this type of thing is a first day in the afternoon and then people can decide do they want to do all of it do they want to do some of it but then it becomes yeah more to be honest is even having longer expert sessions in the past years has always been logistic trouble. Yeah. With conference starting on Monday not being able to gather rooms on Sunday, so I find it quite difficult. I think an alternative version would be to kind of keep the 3C collection as the main collection and then work with one or two satellite collections which could rotate, right? Yeah now there's the question of how much more do we learn now from, for example, the medical collection? We know it's extremely hard. Do we need to lower? Is this now the new site collection that we would code? Yeah. So I personally would even prefer using only v3c and VPS in the future, but for question answering tasks, the medical data set maybe again and removing also the MVK again. But I mean this is a good direction to plan the next generation of challenge data set. Because v3c was primarily designed for track width. So I had quite some discussions with the people behind track width, specifically the ADS track at track width to see, okay, what is it they would want and need from this. and then it was mostly oh we have this new thing we might as well use it for VBS as well
